greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) is the number of order-preserving full contraction mappings (of an n-chain) with exactly k fixed points.
comment: T(n,k) is also the total number of occurrences of parts k in all compositions (ordered partitions) of n, see example. The equivalent sequence for partitions is A066633. _Omar E. Pol_, Aug 26 2013
reference: A. D. Adeshola, V. Maltcev and A. Umar, Combinatorial results for certain semigroups of order-preserving full contraction mappings of a finite chain, (submitted 2013).
link: A. D. Adeshola, V. Maltcev and A. Umar, Combinatorial results for certain semigroups of order-preserving full contraction mappings of a finite chain, arXiv:1303.7428 [math.CO], 2013.
example: T(5,3) = 5 because there are exactly 5 order-preserving full contraction mappings (of a 5-chain) with exactly 3 fixed points, namely: (12333), (12334), (22344), (23345), (33345).
Note that column k is column 1 shifted down by k positions.
Row 4 is [12, 5, 2, 1]: in the compositions of 4
there are 12 parts=1, 5 parts=2, 2 part=3, and 1 part=4.
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 11}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 21 2018 *)
results.author: _Abdullahi Umar_, Feb 28 2013
